description: On 21 March the Government of Madagascar declared a Health State of Emergency (set to last two weeks, but extendable).

On 21 March the Government of Madagascar declared a nationwide State of Health Emergency (set to last two weeks, but extendable). UPDATE: The previous State of Health Emergency was set to last until April 4, it has been extended to April 19.

On 21 March the Government of Madagascar declared a nationwide State of Health Emergency (set to last two weeks, but extendable). UPDATE: The previous State of Health Emergency was set to last until April 19, it has been extended by 15 days.
Cruise ships will not be permitted to berth in Madagascar's ports for 30 days from 15 March.
Madagascar is enforcing a suspension of all international air travel starting from March 20, for 30 days.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Chad has received it official donation of Tambavy Covid-Organics [CVO] from the government delegation of Madagascar. They were transported by special aircraft. 
Chad received its order of 20,000 doses of CVO, the remedy is intended to be distributed to all the provinces of chad.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: All access to the Analamanga region is closed, and health barriers are reinforced.

In Madagascar, as of March 26,2020, confinement measures have been put in place in order to curb the communal spread of COVID-19. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.

In Madagascar, as of March 28,2020, per the latest State of Emergency requirements, strict confinement measures are in place starting at 12 pm. only those with valid authorization will be allowed to move around outside.

description: The government of Madagascar announced that all districts and regions are to resume all activities, except for 5 areas (the district of Toamasina I and II, Fénérive-Est, Moramanga, and the Analamanga region.

In Madagascar, as of March 26, 2020, confinement measures have been put in place in order to curb the communal spread of COVID-19. Everyone has been asked to stay inside except in emergency situations.
In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, stay-at-home measures continue indefinitely. UPDATE: Confinement measures announced on March 26th continue indefinitely.

description: In Madagascar, as of March 23, 2020, only shops selling basic goods will remain open: supermarkets, grocery stores, and neighborhood markets (open between 6 a.m. to 12 p.m.) Only one person per household may do the shopping - this can be arranged with the Commune and drugstores, gas stations and banks will remain open.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: In Madagascar, as of April 5, 2020, all schools, churches, and all public spaces (bars, restaurants, shops, karaokes, etc.) will remain closed until April 19th. UPDATE: The initial closure did not specify an end date but the government of Madagascar has now closed schools, churches, and all public spaces (bars, restaurants, shops, karaokes, etc.) until April 19th.
